title: BBC Local Live: Norfolk - BBC News
summary: commissioner 'sorry ' for police response to cromer 'disorder ' .
engineering works to disrupt rail travel from sunday .

documents.title: norwich and nottingham to host unesco global literature gathering
text: two of the uk 's four cities of literature have won the right to co-host the unesco global literature gathering in 2019 .
cultural leaders from 28 countries are set to visit for the prestigious forum and this will be the first time it has ever taken place in england .
author: Eastern Daily Press

documents.title: stone laid in memory of diss soldier
text: a stone-laying service has been carried out near diss for a local man who led the last great cavalry charge on the western front in world war one a century ago .
the battle at moreuil wood in picardy , france , was led by norfolk-born lt gordon flowerdew of the canadian army , who died from his injuries .

at easter , servicemen from the cavalry recreated his action , which is credited with halting the german offensive in northern france and for which flowerdew posthumously received the victoria cross .
family members were present as the stone was laid at billingford church .

documents.title: 'sparkling ' vineyard ' for burnham market
text: a farmer in north norfolk is hoping to turn his hand to wine production having just planted a new vineyard with the hope of producing sparkling wine if it 's a success .
robert perowne 's vineyard is on a south facing slope just outside burnham market , where it catches the sun but has shelter from the cold north wind .
he thinks it 'll be three years before a proper harvest and there 's a lot to do in that time .

norfolk already has an award-winning vineyard in the south of the county at surlingham where winbirri vineyard 's bacchus 2015 was named best single varietal white wine by the decanter world wine awards in 2017 .

documents.title: waitrose branches to test disposable cup phase-out
text: waitrose branches in the east of england are among the first to trial the store 's plan to remove all disposable drinks cups from its shops .
according to the parliamentary environmental audit committee , the uk throws away 2.5 billion disposable coffee cups a year , almost none of which are recycled because of their plastic lining .
disposable cups will be removed from all waitrose 's 350 stores by the autumn , but nine have been chosen for a trial of the plan from 30 april .

the first branches to dump the disposables are in billericay in essex ; ipswich futura park , sudbury and newmarket in suffolk ; norwich and wymondham in norfolk ; and cambridge 's fitzroy street branch .
waitrose stores in banbury , oxfordshire and upminster in east london will also be involved in the trial , which it says shows its `` commitment to plastic and packaging reduction '' .

documents.title: sunderland v norwich city
text: sunderland v norwich city

documents.title: royal duo seek donations instead of gifts
text: royal duo seek donations instead of gifts

documents.title: what to look out for in may 's local elections
text: what to look out for in may 's local elections

documents.title: another hemsby chalet teeters on the brink
text: a waiting game continues for the owner of this bungalow whose foundations were exposed and left unsupported on the cliff edge at hemsby following last month 's storms .
the bbc understands the chalet 's owner was not living in the property .

in a statement , great yarmouth borough council said surveyors and environmental services officers are continuing to review the situation with respect to the eight properties at the marrams `` which remain at significant risk of being lost through the settlement of the cliffs following the storm '' .
`` the council is aware that one property is now further undermined and the council is investigating the latest situation , '' the statement said .
the public is being advised to continue to stay away from the beach and cliffs below the marrams .
`` we will continue to keep in touch with affected residents and property owners , who have been advised not to move back into the properties , '' a council spokesman said .

documents.title: driver with baby clocked doing 105mph
text: driver with baby clocked doing 105mph

documents.title: warning from fire service as fens flooding continues
text: cambridgeshire fire & rescue service is warning people not to take risks as flooding continues to affect roads on the norfolk border , as other parts of the county .
last week the wisbech crew had to use their water rescue sled to save a man who had become stranded in his car in flood water in the welney washes .

sutton gault causeway near mepal remains closed because of flooding from the river great ouse , as does the causeway at welney , which has about 32cm of water on the road , according to the environment agency .
update : # suttongault causeway remains closed in both directions due to flooding .
a number of roads are still affected by flooding today .
keep an eye on @ twitterid for the latest , and remember , never try to drive or walk through flood water .
it could be deeper than you think !
# thinkdontsink

documents.title: memorial drive held for crash death teens
text: memorial drive held for crash death teens

documents.title: still no solution for welney causeway flooding
text: a study to see whether flooding on a fens road could be alleviated would cost about £ 100,000 , a council says .
the welney causeway , the a1101 link road link between wisbech and downham market , left drivers having to take a 30-mile detour over the easter weekend after heavy rainfall saw it flood .
the causway is prone to flooding and despite some high profile meetings involving local mps four years ago , a solution still has not been found .

in a statement norfolk county council said a feasibility study had been carried out on a scheme to alleviate some of the flood impact , but this would also need an environmental impact assessment ( eia ) , which would cost about £ 100,000 .
`` as this is not something we could readily fund we would need to seek funding from other agencies .
`` the site is very sensitive having many stakeholder groups .
it has lots of environment designations , is a recognised water reservoir , is a rspb reserve , and is flooded to protect the fens by the environment agency . ''

documents.title: memorial road run held for pulham market crash trio
text: the first anniversary of the death of three teenagers , who died when their car hit trees and burst into flames in south norfolk , was marked yesterday .

the driver , kyle warren from harleston , was with dominic o'neill from pulham market and billy hines from wortham , when they were killed in the accident which happened at about 23:50 on 5 april 2017 near pulham market .
mr warren , who was 17 , was a stock car enthusiast who had only passed his driving test a fortnight before the crash .
their friends gathered in diss for a memorial road run .

at the inquest into their deaths in january , a police report determined the most likely cause of the collision was `` excess speed , lack of experience and the manner of driving combined with the possibility mr warren 's ability to drive was impaired by the cocaine and mdma ( ecstacy ) he had consumed '' although the coroner said there was no evidence drug use had contributed to the crash .

documents.title: police stop 105mph driver with baby in front seat
text: central team stopped a car # a11 # wymondham travelling at 105mph earlier .
the team was shocked to find a 12month baby in a carseat on the front passenger seat # fatal4 # slowdown # 1193
totally disgusted reading this thank goodness you stopped them
hopefully a lengthy ban and hefty fine will ensue .
a lesson to us all # slowdown

great work

you have every reason to make a lot of wonga out of this one guys .

text: hundreds 'stick tongue out ' to cancer

text: norwich city 3-1 aston villa

documents.title: gp struck off over naked whatsapp photos
text: gp struck off over naked whatsapp photos

documents.title: ten schools opting for academy status win government approval
text: ten suffolk primary schools could become academies after winning approval from the department for education .

helmingham community primary school , shotley community primary school , stutton church of england voluntary controlled primary school and all saints church of england voluntary aided primary school in newmarket are converting already .
all saints will join the st edmundsbury and ipswich diocesan multi-academy trust in july while stutton will be run by asset education from june .
trusts for helmingham and shotley have not yet been disclosed .
august is the proposed date for shotley to be run as an academy .

four church of england schools - stradbroke , fressingfield , all saints in laxfield and st peter and st paul in eye , as well as wortham primary school on the suffolk/norfolk border and woods loke primary school near lowestoft have all opted for academy status and have begun conversion and are searching for sponsors .

documents.title: norwich 's sainsbury centre turns 40
text: the sainsbury centre for visual arts - the first public building designed by architect norman foster - is 40 years old on saturday .
the gallery was first conceived after sir robert sainsbury , grandson of the supermarket founder , and his wife donated their art collection to the university of east anglia in norwich in 1973 .

the gallery said hundreds of thousands of people have visited the centre on the uea campus in the past four decades and it was marking the milestone with a `` fitting '' retrospective exhibition on architecture called superstructures .

documents.title: calls for ban on goldfish as prizes at pleasure beach
text: a petition is calling for a fairground to stop giving away goldfish as prizes .
live fish are among the prizes at the hook-a-duck stall at great yarmouth pleasure beach .

as reported in the great yarmouth mercury , the online petition by emily burrows of norwich claims prize-winners have no idea how to care for the fish , which become `` easily stressed and may even die from changes in water temperature or oxygen starvation '' .
it has attracted more than 1,200 signatories .
albert jones , managing director of the pleasure beach , said the practice was not illegal and it provided small tanks , food and care instructions .
children had to be accompanied by a parent or guardian and fish could be collected before the journey home , [ or ] on another day , he added .
`` we have taken advice from a local pet shop and it is no different to how they sell their goldfish , '' he said .
`` this is something we only had good feedback on and have people travel down just to win . ''

documents.title: cyclist dies two days after collision in norwich
text: a cyclist has died after he was hit by a car in norwich .
the man , who was in his 30s , was on aylsham road , near mecca bingo , when he collided with a black audi q7 at about 16:00 on tuesday .
he was taken to addenbrooke 's hospital with life-threatening injuries and died on thursday .
norfolk police said a man , also in his 30s , has been arrested on sus of drink-driving , drug-driving and dangerous driving .
he been released under investigation .

documents.title: norwich teacher gets the boots
text: a teacher in norwich has been overwhelmed by the response to her appeal for football boots for her primary school team .
jade copeman , 23 , a teacher at lakenham primary school , wanted her school team to enter a local tournament on 18 april , but found that a few of her players could not afford proper boots .
so she used twitter and facebook to appeal for boots .
`` i could not believe the response .
i anticipated a few pairs of boots , but we 've had more than 100 offers and my tweets have been retweeted 1,000 times , '' she said .
since the appeal three days ago , she has already received four pairs of boots (
ms copeman , who plays for stalham town ladies football team , said any extra pairs of boots they get - her team is made up of 13 pupils - will be distributed among schools across norfolk .
anyone who wants to donate any boots should contact jade via her twitter feed @ twitterid
i still ca n't believe the response i 've had !
done a few phone interviews today and i 'm going for an interview on the radio tomorrow morning as well !
you 're amazing
so are you ! !
cool !
well 4 pairs of boots are on there way today glad they 're going to good use .
great job !
author: Nic Rigby
BBC News

documents.title: new bird hide for springwatch reserve
text: new bird hide for springwatch reserve

documents.title: premier inn jobs ' boost as new £ 7.5m seafront hotel takes shape
text: the new £ 7.5m premier inn taking shape in great yarmouth will create 70 new jobs when it opens next year .
author: Eastern Daily Press

documents.title: cyclist 's 'struggle ' after horrific crash
text: cyclist 's 'struggle ' after horrific crash

documents.title: air ambulance called to norfolk village after man is injured in fire
text: a man has been taken to hospital by the air ambulance after sustaining injuries in an incident involving a fire , near swaffham .
emergency services were called to chapel road , which runs between the village of necton and the hamlet ivy todd , at around 12.15pm on wednesday .
author: Eastern Daily Press

documents.title: mother of boxer who died at great yarmouth event seeks answers
text: the mother of a boxer who died after his first fight in great yarmouth says she can not rest until she sees justice for her son .
jakub moczyk , also known as kuba , 22 , died after being knocked out at the atlantis arena in great yarmouth , norfolk , in 2016 , in an unlicensed boxing match .
unlicensed boxing events are legal , but there are no minimum safety standards , prompting concerns .
an inquest into his death last year recorded a conclusion of misadventure , but no-one involved with the fight or venue admitted responsibility .
in an interview with the bbc , mr moczyck 's mother jolanta smigaj ( below centre ) and her partner brian cook , said they were the `` victims '' and no-one was being held responsible for the death .
`` i 'm going to fight for justice for my son .
i have to find out why , i have no answers , '' she said .
in a statement , great yarmouth borough council said its thoughts and sympathies remained with mr moczyk 's family and friends .
the spokesman added : `` officers are working as a priority to complete the investigation as soon as possible , and are keeping in touch with the family as it progresses .
`` legislation is in place to help protect people 's safety .
the law places a duty of compliance on others under both the health and safety at work act and the licensing act .
the council expects the law to be complied with and will investigate where concerns are raised and/or where incidents occur . ''
author: Andrew Turner
BBC Radio Norfolk

documents.title: neves and fulham duo up for efl award
text: neves and fulham duo up for efl award

documents.title: tk maxx store plan for norwich
text: dozens of jobs will be created if councillors back plans for a discount fashion store on the edge of norwich .
a full planning application for a new tk maxx has been submitted to south norfolk council by bullen properties .
author: Eastern Daily Press

documents.title: lorry with live animals inside crashes near northwold
text: a lorry carrying live animals has ended up in a ditch in norfolk .
it happened around 05:30 today , between whittington and northwold , on whittington hill .
author: Eastern Daily Press

documents.title: rabbits on run after 17 dumped at easter
text: rabbits on run after 17 dumped at easter

documents.title: council failed to close flooded road in welney despite warning
text: a highways authority has admitted it failed to close the a1101 wash road , which flooded at welney on the norfolk/cambridgeshire border , because it failed to up a warning from the environment agency ( ea ) .
an ea spokesman said it alerted norfolk county council to the flooding at about 00:10 on monday , but no action was taken to close the flooded road until today .
norfolk county council said : `` our highways teams were very busy over the weekend due to rainfall and flooding .
`` in this instance unfortunately it seems that this particular message was not up our end .
`` we closed the road today as soon as we were made aware of the flooding . ''
the ea said it was talking to norfolk county council to ensure better communication in future .
author: Nic Rigby
BBC News

documents.title: paralysed man to walk london marathon
text: a paralysed man is hoping to become the first paraplegic male to walk the london marathon .
simon kindleysides , 34 , from norwich , was diagnosed with a brain tumour in 2013 which left him paralysed from the waist down .
it will take the father-of-three 37 hours to complete the course wearing an exoskeleton suit .

documents.title: battle of britain aircraft to fly at great yarmouth air show
text: we earlier reported that the red arrows were bringing their thrilling display to the first haven great yarmouth air show this summer .
the event on 16-17 june will also feature the battle of britain memorial flight and the raf tutor display team .
show director asa morrison said : `` the raf teams are a huge draw and people travel from all over the country to see them .
`` we were n't sure the red arrows would be able to come to yarmouth following the fatal accident involving one of the team 's hawk aircraft in anglesey earlier this month .
`` they are a very close-knit team , but they have decided to proceed with their 2018 programme and we are deeply grateful that they have agreed to include a two-day visit to great yarmouth . ''
the air show is organised by the greater yarmouth tourism and business improvement area and it is expected to attract 170,000 people and generate £ 10m for local traders .
author: Nic Rigby
BBC News

documents.title: fen flood levels measured in hash browns and iphones
text: parts of cambridgeshire and norfolk have been flooded following heavy rain at the weekend .
but here 's a novel way of getting your head around just how much water is out there - measure it in iphones or hash brown potato cakes .
that 's the suggestion of chris beale , whose post in the upwell and outwell facebook group prompted much hilarity .
`` welney is currently flooded to a depth of 4 inches .
for you young people who do n't work in imperial , that 's the equivalent of about 8 iphones stacked on top of each other or about 5 hash browns from mcdonald 's , '' he wrote .
`` now at the height of 1 happy meal box or 3 big mac meals .
for those that need this in something more specific it 's 0.125 fathoms , '' he added later .
for more traditional information about water levels in your area , type your location into the environment agency website here .

documents.title: breakingred arrows to headline great yarmouth air show
text: world famous aerobatics team the red arrows are to headline the inaugural haven great yarmouth air show this summer .
the royal air force announced today that the crack team will headline both days of the sea front event , which takes place 16-17 june .
author: Nic Rigby
BBC News

documents.title: consultation on merger of colleges in great yarmouth and lowestoft
text: plans to merge two neighbouring colleges in norfolk and suffolk have been put up for public consultation .
the move could see the merger of east coast college , based in great yarmouth and lowestoft , and lowestoft sixth form college , in august this year .
students , parents , staff , and local employers are being invited to express their views .
the colleges said the merger would mean a more financially sustainable organisation .
the final decision will fall to the governing bodies of each college .
author: Nic Rigby
BBC News

documents.title: norwich cathedral falcon lay four eggs
text: norwich 's famous cathedral peregrine falcons have laid four new eggs .
nesting under a camera on the spire , people around the world have been watching the online feed of the peregrines .
zoe smith , of the hawk and owl trust , said both of the adults have shared incubation duties .
`` you 'll see them sometimes on the web camera switching over , '' she said .
`` that 's really exciting to see them changing over giving the other one nest relief .
`` hopefully in the next 33 days the eggs will hatch and we 'll have four chicks . ''
author: Nic Rigby
BBC News

documents.title: dog walker robbed at knifepoint in norfolk village
text: a man was was robbed at knifepoint and sustained a minor neck injury when he was approached by four men in a small norfolk village .
author: Eastern Daily Press

documents.title: norwich northern distributor road to be renamed the broadland northway
text: just weeks before the road is due to be fully opened , council leaders have plumped for the new name , having considered a number of options .
author: Eastern Daily Press

documents.title: man stabbed in mugging in king 's lynn
text: a man 's been stabbed during one of two robberies in king 's lynn .
the first incident happened at around 16:20 on tuesday as the teenager cycled between the iron bridge and the fairstead estate .
four men pulled him off his bike and assaulted him , leaving him with a knife wound on his back before stealing his bike .
two hours later another man suffered head and facial injuries after he was robbed of his laptop on gayton road by three men .
three teenage boys arrested in connection with that incident have been released on bail .

documents.title: ultra-fast broadband rolls out in scole
text: a little bit of history has taken place at the community centre in scole after locals in five villages , fed up with low broadband speeds , connected to ultra-fast broadband which they built and supplied themselves .
people now have a download speed of 800 megabits , as opposed to the average speed of 28 megabits for rural norfolk provided by major suppliers .
with the help of local farmers , fibre optic cables were bought and buried and hooked up to a super fast main frame .
all the work was carried out by volunteers and the scheme is run by a cooperative called b4rn , on a not-for-profit basis , and will cost subscribers around £ 30 per month .
similar schemes were first set up in rural lancashire .

documents.title: abolition of pcsos plan going ahead
text: abolition of pcsos plan going ahead

documents.title: single-punch attack killer jailed
text: single-punch attack killer jailed

documents.title: hemsby hoping tourists will still come
text: the district council for hemsby says the village is very much open for business this easter , despite the recent erosion which led to the demolition of several cliff-top chalets :

documents.title: beeston 'bump ' renewed pathway ropens
text: an improved path at beeston hill in sheringham reopens today .
up to 2,000 walkers are expected to head there this weekend , according to the county council which carried out the improvements .
a helicopter lifted 109 tonnes of granite and carstone to fix the path , which had become worn down .
the funding for the upgrade was provided mostly by natural england .
the new surface has been put in place along the norfolk coast path from sheringham to the top of beeston hill , known locally as the beeston `` bump '' .

documents.title: sunny and bright in norwich
text: say `` hi '' if you see him
good morning .
currently out on foot patrol in # norwich city centre not the worst place to patrol @ twitterid

documents.title: world cup 1970 panini album stolen
text: a football sticker album dating back to the mexico 1970 world cup has been stolen in a burglary , police say .
the book was taken by thieves along with a `` large amount of high-value panini collectables '' from a home in brundall , norfolk .
police urged anyone who had been offered the items for sale to contact them .
the thieves struck at strumpshaw road on saturday , between 15:00 and 19:30 gmt , and also took porcelain figurines .
police said they wanted to hear from anyone who may have spotted anything sus in strumpshaw road , station road or station new road between those times .

documents.title: millions of mammals trapped and killed by roadside rubbish
text: more than three million tiny animals a year could be killed by uk drivers throwing rubbish from their cars , according to new research carried out in south norfolk .
researchers collected the remains of shrews , voles and mice trapped in bottles and cans alongside roadsides and lay-bys .
environmental charity keep britain tidy will launch a new campaign over the next month , based on the findings .
the charity said the mammals are a vital part of our wildlife heritage and an essential link in the food chain .
report author graham moates said : `` we found 5 % of bottles and cans discarded containing small mammals , with an average of two per can . ''
new regulations making it easier for councils to fine car owners over littering will come into force next month .

documents.title: gang of 19 people held after police raids over tobacco smuggling
text: police have arrested 19 people during a string of raids in norfolk in connection with tobacco smuggling and money laundering .
drugs , a firearm and ammunition , jewellery and five cars were seized after police together with hm revenue and customs officers swooped on 22 addresses across king 's lynn and swaffham .
the thirteen men and six women , aged between 20 and 58 , were arrested on tuesday .
supt dave buckley , of norfolk police , said the operation demonstrated the force 's commitment to disturbing `` criminal gangs who operate locally '' .

documents.title: hemsby 'open for business ' , say council and tourism chiefs
text: visitors are being welcomed to a seaside village for the start of the holiday season , days after its coastline suffered devastating damage .
five chalets were demolished when storms eroded sand dunes in hemsby , norfolk (

the deputy leader of great yarmouth borough council , carl smith , has said despite the `` heartbreaking '' scenes , tourists still needed to visit the resort over easter otherwise the `` community will suffer further '' .
gareth brown , from the greater yarmouth tourism and business improvement area , echoed mr smith 's message .
`` hemsby 's tourism businesses will be very much open for easter , '' he said .
however , visitors are still being warned to stay away from the affected area , east of the marrams , and the beach below the cliffs .

documents.title: colman 's factory closure confirmed
text: colman 's factory closure confirmed

documents.title: colmans to close norwich factory
text: colman 's will close its norwich factory by 2019 , putting 113 jobs at risk .

jon strachan , vice president supply chain unilever uk & ireland , which owns the brand , said the closure `` follows britvic 's decision last year that it will close its factory on our shared site '' .
unilever said the manufacturing of the vast majority of products will move to a factory in burton upon trent .
however , unilever said it will maintain links to norwich where the mustard has been made since 1814 .

`` we intend to retain the production and packing of colman 's mustard powder , the historic mustard milling process and mint processing in a new state-of-the-art milling facility in the norwich area , created through a new long-term partnership with a consortium of local growers , backed by significant investment from unilever . ''
around 40 roles will transfer to burton and the new milling facility near norwich will create some 25 jobs .

documents.title: dutch masterpiece found to de pirate battle
text: one of the largest paintings in the national trust 's collection in norfolk has been found to de a different scene to what was originally thought .
a maritime painting by 17th century dutch artist simon de vlieger , which has hung at felbrigg hall for more than 250 years , was believed to portray the siege of amoy .
however , experts now believe the battle scene illustrates a chinese and dutch attack on pirates that took place three years earlier in 1630 .
the national trust said the artist 's exacting detail led them to question the subject of the masterpiece 's scene .

documents.title: 'jesus , mary and joseph ' : tornado flight for bbc radio 4 presenter
text: radio 4 has been broadcasting from raf marham in norfolk this morning to mark the centenary of the service .
broadcaster sarah montague , from the today programme , was taken for a flight in a supersonic tornado attack bomber - ahead of its retirement next year .
sarah montague

in case it is n't obvious .

the jets have been on the frontline of the raf 's missions for nearly 40 years , from the cold war to operations in kosovo , iraq and syria .
wing commander james heeps took the presenter for a trip from marham - where tornados have been based since 1990 - to merseyside .
the base is preparing to welcome its new f-35b lightning ii fast jets later this year .

documents.title: rail works add to easter traffic jams
text: rail works add to easter traffic jams

documents.title: couple celebrate 70th wedding anniversary despite 'unromantic ' proposal
text: a couple from dereham in norfolk , whose romance began when they started writing to each other during world war two , are celebrating their 70th wedding anniversary .
lily dawson , 92 , said she and her husband douglas , 94 , had been `` fortunate '' to spend seven decades together despite a disappointing proposal .
`` he did n't make a very good job of it , to tell you the truth , '' she said .
`` he just sort of said shall we get engaged it was n't very romantic . ''
however , douglas - who was in the navy when they courted - said he knew how lucky he was when lily agreed to become his wife .
`` i knew that it would be one of the biggest blessings of my life when i married her , '' he said .
`` from the start you just have to give and take , accept things , forgive things and just keep pressing on . ''

documents.title: families face more late night disruption due to norwich road resurfacing
text: families are facing even more late night and early morning disruption because of resurfacing work on a norwich road .
author: Norwich Evening News

documents.title: norwich fans help raise £ 5m for academy
text: norwich fans help raise £ 5m for academy

documents.title: surgeon 's victims 'at heart ' of inquiry
text: surgeon 's victims 'at heart ' of inquiry

documents.title: masked thieves raid stradbroke spar store
text: about four masked raiders have forced entry to a convenience store and made off with cigarettes and alcohol .
the spar on church street in stradbroke , near eye in suffolk , was targeted by the thieves at about 22:15 yesterday .
police said they arrived in a dark-coloured saloon car and after forcing entry using crowbars and loaded up the vehicle and left .
they `` smashed it to pieces '' , said manager liz dawson .
`` the lady who lives upstairs opened her window and shouted at the burglars and they attacked her with drinks and bottles thrown at the window , '' she added .

documents.title: hemsby clifftop homes demolition due to begin on friday
text: we 've heard that the homes teetering on the edge of the eroding clifftop in hemsby in norfolk are due to begin to be demolished from 08:30 on friday .

documents.title: norman ruins of original church discovered in norwich
text: footings of the original norman church have been discovered on the site where one of norwich 's landmark places of worship was later built .
st peter mancroft on millennium plain is being renovated to include a larger area for performances as well as worship .
workers renovating the floor found two norman stone pillars in the basement where they expected to find more recent medieval ones .
it 's the first glimpse of the original church , which was built c.1075 , which was demolished to make way for st peter mancroft which dates from 1430 .
anna moskvina , church verger , said it was `` very lucky that we 've seen this bit of the church '' , but she ruled out a full excavation .

documents.title: deadline looms on greater norwich housing plan
text: a consultation into where thousands of homes will be built around norwich and surrounding areas closes at 17:00 today .
the greater norwich local plan looks at where more than 7,000 homes should be built in south norfolk , broadland and norwich over the next 18 years .

documents.title: structural engineers to assess hemsby cliffs after high tide
text: structural engineers are expected to re-assess the safety of cliff-top houses teetering on the edge of the beach at hemsby after coastal erosion last weekend .
fifteen people have been left homeless after residents were forced to leave 13 bungalows on the marrams when they became unsafe .
five of the homes are expected to be demolished before easter , but structural engineers will re-assess the situation following thursday 's mid-morning high tide .
john weston , managing agent for landowners geoffrey watling ltd , says any work to secure the other homes on the cliffs would depend on government funding .

`` there are currently trials of blocks and gabions in place , which are being assessed for their effectiveness , but at present there 's no public funding allocated for what would be a multi-million pound investment , '' he said .

documents.title: man killed in thorpe market car crash
text: a man has been killed after two cars crashed on a norfolk road early on wednesday .
the victim , who was driving a vauxhall corsa , died at the scene on the a149 cromer road , near the junction with the b1436 , in thorpe market (
the female driver of a hyundai tuscan suffered serious injuries and was taken to norfolk and norwich university hospital , police said .
the road was closed for more than five hours after police were called to reports of the crash at 07:50 .
any witnesses who saw the collision or saw the cars being driven beforehand have been asked to contact police .

documents.title: biker taken to hospital after crash closes roundabout
text: a motorcyclist has been taken to hospital with head and arm injuries following a crash between his bike and a car in a norfolk town .
officers said they were called to fuller 's hill , great yarmouth , just before 12:20 today .
the air ambulance also attended the scene and the roundabout was closed for an hour while it landed , with traffic diverted down northgate street .
the biker , in his 20s , was taken to the james paget hospital , in gorleston , by road , said an east of england ambulance service spokesman .

text: a busy road in norfolk has been closed following a `` serious '' crash , police have said .
two cars hit each other on the a149 cromer road in thorpe market , just before 08:00 .
emergency services were at the scene and road diversions are in place , police added .

documents.title: network of fountains aims to cut waste in norwich
text: public drinking fountains could be installed across norwich city centre again in a bid to cut waste .
the fountains , which cost up to £ 6,000 each , could be approved by city councillors tonight .
it is hoped the proposal would mean fewer disposable plastic bottles being used as it would be easier for people to use refillable bottles
if the project gets backing , residents will be asked where they would like the points to be located .
norwich would be following in the footsteps of cities including bristol and hull , while london plans to install 20 new fountains this year .

documents.title: hemsby homes teetering on the brink in the 1980s
text: with the sea claiming a few more metres of hemsby in recent days , take a look back at this footage from the east coast a few decades ago when residents faced a similar fate
after cliff-top homes in hemsby came under threat yet again this weekend , we 've had a delve in the @ twitterid archives .
my job literally relates to this kind of thing , heh .
author: BBC Look East

documents.title: norwich city winger celebrates 100th game with win
text: norwich city 's 3-2 victory over reading was their first win since early february and the perfect way for winger josh murphy to clock-up a career milestone .
the 23-year old made his 100th appearance for the canaries in the game .
he came through the youth ranks at carrow road alongside twin brother jacob , who was sold to newcastle united last summer .
murphy told me `` it 's a great achievement .
`` i ca n't stay young forever , it was good to be out there and i feel like part of the furniture now . ''
author: Chris Goreham
BBC Radio Norfolk sport
